revised_title: The Direct Guaiacum Reaction and the Role of Pyrocatechin in Plant Extracts
tldr: The author investigates the direct guaiacum reaction in plant extracts and concludes that the presence of dihydric phenol, pyrocatechin, in plant tissues is responsible for this reaction. The presence of pyrocatechin leads to the oxidation of the plant extracts, enabling the peroxidase enzyme to transfer oxygen to the guaiacum. This research provides insight into the metabolic processes of certain plants and the role of pyrocatechin in their metabolism.
